item.description:
Meetings

Pre

Intro (20/01/2022)

  • Links

    • Video
    • Slides

  • Objectives

    • Communicate group’s pedagogy, Including motivation, goals, and activities.

Week 0

First Meeting (05/02/2022)

  • Links

    • Audio

  • Objectives

    • Networking, Where Members introduce themselves (15 min)
    • Discussion, On students' collaboration and online communities; Their challenges and suggested solutions (20 min)
    • Discussion, On members' skills and goals, and how to leverage that for projects and subsidy learning (10 min)
    • Gaming, Multiplayer among members (5 min)

  • Summary

    • members introduce themselves
      • amir: fresh highschool alumini. applied to undergrad cs school in india. online community is a new experience for him. mostly had been self-studying on his own.
      • dharshen k: india. electronics and communication engineering. interestd more in computer science.
      • forkan: turkey. mechatronics master student, background is in control engineering. done previous projects in machine learning and dynamical systems.
    • mostafa pointed to curious intersections between computer science and information/communication, and that he wishes to benefit from dharshen’s background.
    • dharshen k expressed why he is motivated him to connect with people through the internet.
    • mostafa addressed that many students belittle the value of conceptual ideas, stories, and motivations, which shaped science directions.
    • amir talked about nasa’s new telescope, and members discussed with him the significance of that. mostafa also addressed with him how fields of engineering and science and mutually benefiting each other.
    • forkan explained how machine learning is contributing to control engineering. Dynamical systems like drones require a designed controller to make them stable. Machine learning can assist in that.
    • mostafa is delighted to have frankon, as he has a domain application through which machine learning can be applied. mostafa values the value of having some end-user to assess the quality of algorithmic techniques deployed.
    • mostafa suggested doing a project related to dynamical systems through purely simulations, Benefiting from forkan’s background.

  • Quotes

    • mostafa: Software engineers build what is well-known to be changed in the future, but mathematicians establish ever lasting truths.
    • dharshen k: I think everyone knows india is one of the most competitive contries. the ratio of acceptance in good jobs is low.
    • dharshen k: Studnets usually reveal only 50% of their work.
    • mostafa: I just wanted to justify for everyone that amir is capable of actively contribuiting to the discussion of this group.
    • forkan: Control systems are applicable to any domain, and that is interesting.

Publications
